646018901.name: The best baseball stadium of Mexico
646018901.author: a TripAdvisor user
646018901.reviewBody: Awesome stadium, it offers all you can desire for a baseball game. The team gathers an average of 16,000 atendees per game. The food is excellent and you can roam the entire stadium for your eye pleasuse. when in town is a must no matter is baseball season or not you can go and feel the ambiance and eat some really good food at Tomo\'s restaurant that is open al year around.  Go and visit you\u00b4ll not regret. Baseball season is from October to January.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jesus Andrade S/N Miguel Aleman

633213711.name: A pleasure to visit...
633213711.author: a TripAdvisor user
633213711.reviewBody: Recently had the pleasure of attending a baseball game at this stadium. The venue is top-notch. Food was delicious. Staff was friendly.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jesus Andrade S/N Miguel Aleman

631504334.name: Fun, Lovely and Innovative (must visit)
631504334.author: a TripAdvisor user
631504334.reviewBody: The tomateros stadium is a very good place to hang out with your friends and family even if you don\'t like baseball. There are great food locals and restaurants all over the stadium. The first time I went I was shocked and overwhelmed by the beauty and the size of this place. It seemed crazy as if it was from another country, due to the quality of it all and the feel you get when you go inside it. Here in Culiacan, Sinaloa, baseball is one of the most famous and enjoyable sports, people love to go see their home team play and win, therefore you will never get bored while visiting this place. Also if you ever get hungry while visiting, there is a wide variety of great quality food to enjoy, you can go from munching on some delicious tacos to having dinner at a fancy delicious sushi restaurant. I believe that the design of the new stadium contributes to all of these things, likewise I believe that the gesture of putting the numbers of the jerseys of past members of the club outside the stadium is really cool and caring. You can see that they were really loved and that they\u2019re missed by the people. You can see there has been a great upgrade from the past stadium and it\u2019s obvious that it took many hours to design and accomplish. It\u2019s also capable of receiving more people and holding more up- level games. In general, the atmosphere is also more diverse and fun. So if you want to have a good time, a good laugh and a good meal this is definitely a place you won\u2019t get disappointed at. \n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jesus Andrade S/N Miguel Aleman

570693028.name: A good place to spend your day.
570693028.author: a TripAdvisor user
570693028.reviewBody: It\'s a huge place with Cin\u00e9polis, food court, supermarket and a lot of other shop were you can find clothes, makeup, ice cream, shoes, etc. A family place.

address.streetAddress: 1787, Blvd. Paseo DE Los Ganaderos Plaza

538602756.name: Very nice and family friendly atmosphere.
538602756.author: a TripAdvisor user
538602756.reviewBody: It\'s quite a nice place, I really enjoyed my visit, the movie theater there is my favorite, as it\'s very comfortable and cheap.

address.streetAddress: 1787, Blvd. Paseo DE Los Ganaderos Plaza

501383079.name: If you want to have a great time.
501383079.author: a TripAdvisor user
501383079.reviewBody: If you want to have a great time, you must go to PLAZA SAN ISIDRO. You can find everything there, Food, Shopping and hanging around.

address.streetAddress: 1787, Blvd. Paseo DE Los Ganaderos Plaza

668178020.name: Activites
668178020.author: a TripAdvisor user
668178020.reviewBody: Great location for outdoors people.\nTook a cruise of the river ..one of three..great for families singles.. everybody...call it the beach of culiacan

559897703.name: Not to much to do here
559897703.author: a TripAdvisor user
559897703.reviewBody: They maje the river edgeges a big largue recreational park Great for all the people, they sell junk food and bad chiniese toys

538577600.name: Fun double bike ride alongside the river
538577600.author: a TripAdvisor user
538577600.reviewBody: You can rent a bike for the whole family and ride alongside the river. It is not a very long distance but the view is really nice and there\u2019s lots of green spaces and trees to lay down and enjoy.

468437263.name: poor experience
468437263.author: a TripAdvisor user
468437263.reviewBody: "Parque de la rivieras" is just a stripe next to the river. There is not much nature, no attractions, just walking paths.

410099073.name: Good for walking or biking
410099073.author: a TripAdvisor user
410099073.reviewBody: It is pretty big in length, you can walk or bike, ideal for families looking forward to have a good time, you can have a family picnic or play a Sport with your kids, there are plenty of food stands where you can buy local food or snacks to complement your visit. Sometimes there are shows in display for free like open theater and live music.

330169850.name: Pleasant park
330169850.author: a TripAdvisor user
330169850.reviewBody: A very pleasant park near the downtown.  It gets you away from the hustle and bustle of the city quite nicely.  Good bike and walking paths.  Bikes available for rent.

312530021.name: Romance and Greenery.
312530021.author: a TripAdvisor user
312530021.reviewBody: The whole of the city and its people live around this amazing little place. Exercise fiends and romantic picnic people everywhere. A must see.

673513611.name: Excelente lugar para hacer oraci\u00f3n
673513611.author: a TripAdvisor user
673513611.reviewBody: Hermoso lugar \nLa celebraci\u00f3n de la eucarist\u00eda y una Omilia de excelencia \u00fatil a mi crecimiento espiritual

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Senora Del Rosario

address.streetAddress: Avenida Alvaro Obregon

670273937.name: emblematica!
670273937.author: a TripAdvisor user
670273937.reviewBody: quien visite culiacan sin conocer la bellisima catedral, definitivamente es como si no visito culiacan!

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Senora Del Rosario

address.streetAddress: Avenida Alvaro Obregon

646029125.name: Excelente lugar para el conocimiento.
646029125.author: a TripAdvisor user
646029125.reviewBody: El centro de ciencias de culiac\u00e1n es un lugar para explorar y aprender acerca de la ciencia en varios aspectos, cuenta con un planetario, entre otros. Lo mejor es que es interactivo, ideal para chicos y grandes. Si tienes ni\u00f1os les encantar\u00e1 y tu aprender\u00e1s con ellos.

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

603672597.name: visita con un grupo de ni\u00f1os
603672597.author: a TripAdvisor user
603672597.reviewBody: fue una visita realmente enriquecedora para los ni\u00f1os ya que tuvieron la oportunidad de conocer acerca del espacio y de los seres vivos, y otros temas de interes.

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

555742375.name: Los culiacanenses lo desaprovechamos pero vale mucho la pena.
555742375.author: a TripAdvisor user
555742375.reviewBody: Es el mejor lugar en la ciudad, es barato y te llena de informaci\u00f3n valiosa, es muy interactivo para los ni\u00f1os y grandes, lo mejor de la ciudad.

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

553853969.name: salvarlo
553853969.author: a TripAdvisor user
553853969.reviewBody: Uno de los grandes problemas del centro de ciencias es que los culichis lo hemos olvidado. Para poder tener lugares de inter\u00e9s de calidad tenemos que visitarlos. El centro de ciencias, junto al bot\u00e1nico, es un lugar hermoso que debemos aprovechar, aumentar nuestra cultura y visitar los espacios de inter\u00e9s.

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

543259912.name: Abandonado
543259912.author: a TripAdvisor user
543259912.reviewBody: El centro de ciencias lo describire como un museo interactivo de las ciencias como la fisica, quimica, ciencias naturales, astronomia, ingenieria,entre otras. En este lugar encontraras artefactos, videos e imagenes relativos a estos temas cuyo objetivo es transmitir conocimiento de forma interesante y divertida. Bien, el proposito del lugar se cumpliria de no ser por contar con artefactos de hace 25 a\u00f1os, algunos obsoletos. sus instalaciones son oscuras y deterioradas. El personal que labora en el sitio son jovenes adolescentes que distan mucho de ser cientificos o personal capacitado para brindarte un recorrido del nivel de un centro de ciencias. Cuenta ademas con una sala de proyecciones llamada planetario que cumple con lo basico pero al igual que el resto de las instalaciones muy vieja. Sin embargo no todo es negativo, su mayor atractivo es uno de los meteoritos mas grandes del mundo el cual esta situado en la explanada del lugar. Otro punto a destacar son los esfuerzos que realiza la administracion del centro de ciencias para promover y organizar eventos astromomicos de observacion y estudio.

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

528600881.name: Did\u00e1cticoe para ni\u00f1os
528600881.author: a TripAdvisor user
528600881.reviewBody: Nos gustomucho l centro de ciencias, aunque deber\u00edan de tener mejor mantenimiento a cada una de las opciones donde se usan botones, ya que hay pocos que no funcionan

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

521779074.name: "Ciencia al alcance"
521779074.author: a TripAdvisor user
521779074.reviewBody: Se tiene la oportunidad de realizar diversas actividades interactivas conectadas con la ciencia en instalaciones confortables, conociendo y aprendiendo.

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

521112574.name: Planetario de primera
521112574.author: a TripAdvisor user
521112574.reviewBody: Soy de Culiac\u00e1n pero a\u00fan as\u00ed me gusta explorar mi ciudad, como el centro de ciencias que por cierto fui con mi esposa hace alrededor de un mes, la pasamos bien, si eres de las personas que les gusta la ciencia o que tiene hijos o sobrinos ll\u00e9venlos, van a pasar un muy buen rato aqu\u00ed, tiene restaurante, un planetario muy bien logrado, biblioteca y tienen actividades para p\u00fablico en general, adem\u00e1s hay cursos buenos algo que decir.. sinceramente si necesita algo de mantenimiento en algunas partes por que ya tiene sus a\u00f1os, pero hay buen material

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

516898878.name: Comida normal sin un sabor preferente.
516898878.author: a TripAdvisor user
516898878.reviewBody: Es un lugar para comer sin esperar un sabor diferente o fuera de lo com\u00fan, los platillos son tradicionales.

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

511054522.name: muy bonita experiencia
511054522.author: a TripAdvisor user
511054522.reviewBody:
esta muy bien
los niños aprenden muchas cosas
sobre todo para niños
recomendado para paseo familiar
la sala audio visual es de otro nivel

address.streetAddress: Avenida de Las Americas Nte 2771

669033897.name: my favorite spot in Culiacan
669033897.author: a TripAdvisor user
669033897.reviewBody: look for the yoga in special night, art exhibit and you can even book romatic dinners, amazing! lots of fun activities here, surrounded by restaurants and great for running or walking your dog.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631484533.name: Nice and peaceful
631484533.author: a TripAdvisor user
631484533.reviewBody: It is a beautiful place! You can go and walk around the garden and enjoy the nice atmophere full of plants. Many people go for jogging and somedays you can take a yoga class.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631263158.name: Is a place you can shill
631263158.author: a TripAdvisor user
631263158.reviewBody: Every time I go to this park is a moment that a cherish a lot, is a place when I can relax and get away from the things I get stressed out every day. \nAlso, they are always making events every week and every event is different sometimes there are movies, sometimes a picnic and sometimes concerts. Its a perfects place you can go with your couple and spend some time with them. Once I went with a friend for a school project I got to see the organization of wedding and I can\'t lie, it was really beautiful and makes me feel I want to have my wedding party here, the idea of the decoration was a combination of modern and natural, there were lightbulbs hanging in the trees, the table decoration was really beautiful, I felt like it was a fairytale. Also the statues and monuments area really beautiful and rich in history, they are perfectly made for this Jard\u00edn. In one, if the jardin allows it, its made to admire the the sunset and the dusk I have never been in one before but i have heard my friends and they told it was really beautiful and worth the price you hve to pay to get into. Also, once i went to a concert of opera here, the decoration was outstanding and they were selling pizza and some other food to make a better experience for the people and to make a better way to remember this magical experience

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631253374.name: Jard\u00edn Bot\u00e1nico Opinion
631253374.author: a TripAdvisor user
631253374.reviewBody: The Botanical Garden is an amazing place, natural, beautiful and cultural for Sinaloa. The last time I went was for an English project within I learned history of it and a lot of things I did not knew before. Did anyone knew it is one of the most important botanical gardens in Mexico? It is one, because it\u00b4s a public space where different activities to promote a culture of respect and rational use of our natural resources. Also, there once was a man, who had an incredible collection of plants and were the engineer of the construction of the botanical garden, his name was Carlos Murrillo Depraect. He made the creation of the garden, a reality. \nIn addition, another amazing fact about this place it is the big collection of art it has. Art pieces from more than 10 different artists, such as Gabriel Orozco, Richard Long, Francis Al\u00ffs and more. Nevertheless, there are two things that personally I loved about this beautiful and magic garden. One, it is practically forced to visit all of it, because if not, people can get lost, well the garden looks like a labyrinth. Two, whenever people are walking around the place, they can feel so pure and loose, because a lot of nature make feel more clean air. All my life I have live in Culiacan and there is no nature place I love more that the botanical garden, as so I said before for me it is so relaxing, pure, magic and beautiful. If you ever come to Culiacan, you definitely have to visit the Botanical Garden.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631225676.name: Absolutely worth it
631225676.author: a TripAdvisor user
631225676.reviewBody: If I were to describe this place in two words it would be a \u201cvisual wonderland\u201d. Jard\u00edn Bot\u00e1nico is a breathtaking place overall; not only does it offer a large range of different gorgeous plant species distributed all along the zone for you to walk through, but it also displays several examples of contemporary art pieces along the way. In my opinion, it\u2019s worth completely worth its price and slight fatigue.\nIf you were to visit the site, I would suggest to hire a guide or an audio tour (the place offers to take one) and to carefully pay attention to the numbers displayed along the park, since that\u2019s the order the site recommends to follow for a more enjoyable experience.\nHence the stunning surroundings, I\u2019d recommend to take a camera and company to enjoy the experience with. However, Culiac\u00e1n\u2019s weather is known for being notoriously hot, therefore I\u2019d advice to wear comfortable, fresh and minimal clothing as well as a thick layer of mosquito repellent. Of course it\u2019s important to bring a drink with you, but from personal experience, my recommendation is to buy lemonade sold in the entrance of the park, it\u2019s really tasty for a good price. Overall, a very enjoyable experience if you do as suggested.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631220365.name: Botanic Garden, and experience that you won\'t forget
631220365.author: a TripAdvisor user
631220365.reviewBody: The Botanic Garden, located in Culiacan, Sinaloa at the north of M\u00e9xico, was built in on 1986, is one of the most incredible and better-known landmarks in Culiacan. There are lots of benefits that the Botanic Garden offers, as an example, the fact that the Botanic Garden is incredibly beautiful, and makes it the perfect place to take an incredible photoshoot, and, if nature is your passion, you can admire the incredible collection of species that this magical place has; it counts with a collection of about 1800 species! And, as you can imagine it is the principal conservation area in Sinaloa. But that is not everything about this amazing place, this is the favorite place of many people to inspire, or directly, present incredible art, such as \u201cNoches de Broadway\u201d; The charming environment that the Botanic Garden adds turns it into something unbelievable. If you prefer to play more than admire, you can have an incredible time each Saturday with the Scout group 10, and you will not only have fun with that nice company, you will also have the chance to change the world along with them. Now that you know all this things about the Botanic Garden, is still Disney better than this?

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631220278.name: A magic place!
631220278.author: a TripAdvisor user
631220278.reviewBody: Recently I have been exploring my City. I went to the Botanic Garden on Saturday. It now has become my favorite place in Culiac\u00e1n for many reasons. First of all, the people that attend you are respectful and friendly, they make your visit feel pleasant and fun. Secondly, it is well maintained. All of the paths I walked on were clean and the plants seem to be water every day because their leaves were bright green. Thirdly, it has one of the most beautiful views I have ever seen because it is full of diverse species of flora and fauna from all around the world. Fourthly, it is interesting, every plant has a little note that shows its origin and name\u00b4s meaning. The prettiest type of flowers that I saw were the aquatic flowers, they had gorgeous colors and they were part of a project that represented the importance of taking care of the marine species. Finally, it has the most fantastic collection of artworks, for example, there are some elevated platforms that have an extraterrestrial feeling that were created to represent an alien invention. I recommend this place to everyone that is curious and is looking for a magical evening.\n

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631110427.name: A fantastic experience
631110427.author: a TripAdvisor user
631110427.reviewBody: The Botanic Garden is one of the most interesting places that you can visit in Culiacan Rosales. Since its inauguration in 1986, this park has been important to the advancements of tourism in Culiacan, and the growth of green areas in our city. This site can be a good experience to learn about the diverse flora found in Mexico, because this location leads programs that educate about botanic science. Other things that you can do in this place is hanging out with your friends and hold meetings, and when you get hungry, there are many restaurants near the garden; or, considering the relaxing environment, this spot is perfect to bring your partner and have a good time with a picnic. Another activity is that you can admire the diverse sculptures of contemporary art that are there, made by different artists. Besides these sculptures, you can visit the Botanic Garden when an artistic event is going to be held, because events such as Tlaneci and Noches de Broadway are a good way to meet diverse artists from Sinaloa, Mexico, and all around the world, and have a good time. In conclusion, this place is a fantastic experience that you can not let down when you take a tour around Culiacan city.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631015304.name: Travel to another dimension
631015304.author: a TripAdvisor user
631015304.reviewBody: Its a very relaxin , beutiful and magic place that counts with huge quantities of differents types of plants that came all around the world. Also it counts with differents sculptures that unite the contemporary with the natural.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

630999127.name: more than a garden
630999127.author: a TripAdvisor user
630999127.reviewBody: Well I think the botanical garden is a great place to go walk, with family, alone, its just amazing. It is not just a garden where you go see plants and thats it, you can actually interact with different activities or services that this garden provides you. You can take pictures and learn about the different plants that you can find there. This garden also provides a lot of different cultural activities such as concerts along the year, movie nights and other different events. \nRecently this place has been remodelated for a better experience for the people go. Schools also can have access to this center by going on a learning trip, this includes a person wich gives you the tour of all the center it very cool.  \nIn this garden you can also do excercise by running around the garden and there are also groups of crossfit training, in wich you can sign up.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

608519390.name: It\'s a beautiful and quiet Garden/Park
608519390.author: a TripAdvisor user
608519390.reviewBody: It\'s an extraordinary and ENORMOUS garden filled with all types of trees and plants. It has different sections and several monuments by local artists. It\'s also great for kids since there are a few small lakes and you can buy fish feed to give to the fish. There is also an exquisite cafe nearby that has the best coffee I\'ve had in my entire life, called Cafe Miro. A delightful place to visit, I\'d only recommend coming in the morning since it gets really hot during the day.\n\n-has a small fee for entrance for maintenance-

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

545062059.name: Worth the trip!
545062059.author: a TripAdvisor user
545062059.reviewBody:
All the greatest pleasures in one place,
The garden itself offers a huge variety of plants, loved the bosque de alimentos,
The contemporary Art pieces are Amazing, 
The special piece from Tino Segal, sang by a soprano is a treat,
The Whole experience makes the trip to culaican worth it!

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

538576793.name: Amazing!!
538576793.author: a TripAdvisor user
538576793.reviewBody: I really loved this place. It has a very wide variety of vegetation from dessert to tropical species. The garden is also filled with installations from different artists all across the place. I would recommend buying insect repellent at the gift shop from the beginning. Also visit early morning before it gets to hot.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

506329115.name: Family Visit
506329115.author: a TripAdvisor user
506329115.reviewBody: Beautiful place.  Nice visit to relax in a quiet peaceful place in town. By the way Tuesdays are free.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

468434014.name: The nicest place in Culiacan
468434014.author: a TripAdvisor user
468434014.reviewBody:
I used to live in Culiacan for over four years. My appartment was located within few minutes walking distance from Jardin Botanico (Botanic Garden).

In my opinion it is defenitely the best place in the city. There are arbols and plants from all over the world. 
Once in a while there are concerts, art exhibitions, and on a weekly basis there are yoga classes.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

458905936.name: Quiet greenspace.
458905936.author: a TripAdvisor user
458905936.reviewBody: Enjoyed to quiet space in the sunshine. Many cactus species and bamboo species are grouped. The various artworks around the Jard\u00edn were pleasant and unintrusive. We found several convenient places to sit and contemplate - or just rest. It seems to be a popular place for photo sessions, as we saw two girls being photographed with their quincea\u00f1era dresses and what appeared to be an engagement photo session.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

409736165.name: Absolutely beautiful
409736165.author: a TripAdvisor user
409736165.reviewBody: My highlight was seeing a hummingbird!  Lot\'s of butterflies and beautiful birds as well as plants. Highly recommend a visit to this oasis.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

398035443.name: Afternoon walk
398035443.author: a TripAdvisor user
398035443.reviewBody: One of my favorite places in town, you can enjoy the beauty of the hundreds of trees and flowers inside and outside of the garden, very peaceful ideal for reading books or spend time with someone you love, there are many workshops for kids and adults too, there is a small cinema inside.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

334455075.name: Encounter
334455075.author: a TripAdvisor user
334455075.reviewBody: To be honest, this place is astonishing! I was not that excited about visiting it because I didn\'t know what to expect besides plants, but the encounter is one of the most amazing things I\'ve ever seen in my entire life. A must if you visit this city.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

290801006.name: Highly recommended, even in summer because there are lots of shade trees.
290801006.author: a TripAdvisor user
290801006.reviewBody: Fantastic, what a great surprise.  Wish we\'d had more time to make our way around this great place.  One of the highlights of trip.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

281040421.name: Unique in its type
281040421.author: a TripAdvisor user
281040421.reviewBody: If you go to Culiacan, please make sure you visit this botanic park. It is wide, big, artistically arranged and has several interesting species with their description. Interesting and peaceful atmosphere when you are there. It is unique in its structure, it\'s difficult to find parks like these in the other States of M\u00e9xico.

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

263504763.name: Fabulous garden
263504763.author: a TripAdvisor user
263504763.reviewBody: What a great place to just wonder around and enjoy an afternoon!  We were absolutely amazed at the number of varieties of bamboo.   There were some really interesting trees that we had never seen before, and a great cactus garden.  Well worth visiting!

address.streetAddress: Calzada de Las Americas 2131 Col. Burocrata

631252301.name: Zoo
631252301.author: a TripAdvisor user
631252301.reviewBody: The last week I visit the Culiacan Zoo because I needed to record a video for a project. I was excited with the idea of visiting the zoo because when I was little I loved to visit it because the animals were beautiful and the facilities were in good conditions. I have not been to the zoo for more than 4 years. Unfortunately, my visit to the zoo in Culiac\u00e1n was not to my liking this time because the animals were not in good conditions. They looked sick and too skinny. In addition, the facilities were not in good condition. Although some time ago they renewed the facilities, they do not give them the necessary maintenance to keep them beautiful. The animals had no water and the space they were in was very small, also, the space they were in was dirty it seems like they do not clean the cages. I think they could do a better job in keeping the animals in good conditions by giving the animals the attention they need. The authorities definitely have to move the facilities to a bigger place so the animals can live in a bigger place where they can run and walk freely and not just in circles. The animals deserve to have medical attention, food and liberty. I am so disappointed with the fact that the government do not give enough importance to something like this. They need to take action because all the animals will not live long under these conditions.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631246268.name: Is neglected
631246268.author: a TripAdvisor user
631246268.reviewBody: When I went to the zoo I noticed it is very neglected and the cages are very ugly. Also, it is kind of abandoned and people tend to leave the place because of its bad smell. Other thing that I noticed when I went is that the things that they sell in the store of souvenirs or snacks it is very expensive, you could buy the same stuff outside for less money and save some money. Facilities in the zoo are very bad. The majority of the cages where animals live does not have water o If they need water in it habitat it is polluted and green. In addition, that water makes the animals to get sick or to smell bad. Furthermore, cages are not big enough for some animal they live there like bears, lions, jaguars, tigers, etc. Some other animals are not well fed and they have some type of malnutrition causing illness or bad formations in their developing.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631219247.name: The Culiacan\'s zoo is an awesome experience
631219247.author: a TripAdvisor user
631219247.reviewBody: The Culiacan\u2019s zoo is an awesome experience for many things. It has animals from all over the world, for example, lions, giraffes, parrots, and colorful fishes. While you are in the zoo, you can have a tour with an expert, so you can understand better the lifestyle of these amazing animals. Also, it has many activities for all ages. For example, for the little ones, there are recreational courses where they can learn about the animals and have fun at the same time. Going with your family y also a great option. The zoo has bathrooms, a nice gift shop where you can buy souvenirs like teddies, caps, t-shirts, etc. Also, there is a good food zone where you can it with family and friends after having an exciting tour around the zoo. We know that nowadays there are many movements against the zoos because they abuse the animals, but in the zoo of Culiacan is a different case. The workers of this place, give lots of love to the animals, take care of them, feed them, and they even name theme. So, if you want to have an awesome experience in Culiacan, you have to go to the zoo.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631112801.name: The most sadness zoo
631112801.author: a TripAdvisor user
631112801.reviewBody: Zoos were created to people, children, young people or adults for meet animals that exist in the world, baecuse is very difficult to visit the places where they are from and know how they live.But when I visited this zoo, I realized that the zoo even look like one. The cages are in very bad shape, also the area of the birds, serpents, etc. Also, I noticed that the animals have a poor care, they look sad, tired and sick, it has bad smell, it is really disgusting. In addition, the price of the visit is very expensive and the zoo dont worth it. A good zoo must always have their cages clean, and should be large enough for the animals comfort. Also, the animals should always look comfort, clean and animated. I hope one day this zoo will be better, for all that animals that are suffering and to improve the visits of the zoo.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631111763.name: My visit to the zoo.
631111763.author: a TripAdvisor user
631111763.reviewBody: My experience visiting this place was very good, for me that I have visited several zoos in the country, I think that this is without a doubt one of the best. I think that in this park they takes good care of the animals, because they look well cared for and also well fed. The living environment is clean so you can walk around the park without any warning. Also this zoo has a wide collection of wildlife such as cats, primates, birds, herbivores and reptiles among which are very interesting animals such as cheetah, king vulture, giraffe, chimpanzee, white lion, lemur of Madagascar, arboreal boas and monsters of Gila. The tour begins visiting the birds, which are in a large cage that you can enter without problem, inside there the birds can fly around you as if they were in their natural h\u00e1bitat. Soon there is the feline area, where you will find the most impressive species found in Africa and other parts of the world. There is an area where it is an open area where it is a simulation of the savannah. There you can find several types of birds and mammals and one of the most interesting attractions is to feed the giraffes. To finish the tour and if you are hungry, there is a small restaurant at the entrance, where you can eat a lunch such as prepared potatoes, cakes, sandwiches, etc. This place is a place where you can spend pleasant moments with your family and live with the animal world that nature gives us

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631091407.name: A stinky experience
631091407.author: a TripAdvisor user
631091407.reviewBody: Okay, my name is Alberto and I live in Culiacan. I used to visit the zoo at least once every month with my family many years ago. I really like animals, in fact, my favorite is the small breeds of chimpanzees. Anyway, a few days ago I visited the zoo after many years on Sunday, my reason for the visit was a school work, although it did not matter because I had time to enjoy the place one more time. I arrived early and there were not so many people, from now on, this is where I started to see some several mistakes. First of all, many of the crystals they had were blurred so I could not appreciate that much. Also, many cages were empty or the animal or the information sheet did not match with the one it was in at that time. Another factor that I did not like was that they were doing repairs at that time, being the hour where there are more people, I don\u2019t think it was necessary. And finally, above all, what I hate the most was the smell in some parts. I would like to say that this does not come from animals, I\'m sure how animals smell. However, that place stinks. That is something that urgently needs to be fixed because at least at me, It pushback from the zoo to never come back. In the end, it was not so bad, but I empathize those points that should improve, a bit bittersweet the visit

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631022953.name: A Zoo in decline
631022953.author: a TripAdvisor user
631022953.reviewBody: My name is Kevin Patricio Qui\u00f1ones Uriarte and I live in Culiac\u00e1n, Sinaloa. Luckily, I visited the Zoo many times in past years, so I have a reference in how the zoo has changed with the pass of the years. I hoped that the zoo would have changed for better but when I started my visit this past Sunday, I shocked because of the aviary status, the whole place was deteriorated, everything was cover with birds poop, the floor of wood did not have some planks, the habitats were all dirty (without maintenance), and a lot of problems that affected the experience of the trip. Besides the aviary there were other points where the zoo leave the visitor with a bad taste in the mouth, all the animals looked sad and there were cages without animals and the reptiliary was closed and for what I know it has been closed since the start of the year, the costs of the food are very expensive and that makes very difficult to families to afford the complete joy of the trip. In the good side of the thinks if you go to the zoo with your family at the weekend you can have a good time, the entrance cost is cheap being 25 pesos the cost for kids and 30 pesos the cost for adults, you can see the animals and if you are a little kid the animals will amaze you with their majesty. In conclusion, the zoo is still a good place to visit but it needs a lot of investment to recover the wonder lost in the past years.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631018224.name: The death of my nose
631018224.author: a TripAdvisor user
631018224.reviewBody:
When I arrived to Culiacan Zoo, I expected to see a better zoo because I have not been there for a while, but I saw the contrast. First of all, there is no energy in the zoo you can feel it like an abandoned place which is waiting to disappear. Animals are unhappy, they jump or move in rarely occasions, I just miss the days when the zoo used to be amazing. However, this is not only zoo´s employees fault  it is fault from the  the government which stopped the inversion in the zoo. For example, like 5 years ago there used to be a bear, but now there is no bear and now the best achievement of the zoo is obtained a giraffe by loan.
Then, the hygiene conditions. These conditions are horrible. When I entered with my friends to do a work this weekend, I could feel how my nose was begging to finish with this. In addition, you can see animals dirty, a notice for employees "you need to clean the animals", specially monkey´s cage because it smells like sewer and to be worse you can see poop in the floor.
Finally, the structure is too weak. When my friends and I went to the aviary, the floor was made of woods, but these woods were in bad conditions so you could hear the crunch of wood and there was an announcement of "Be careful where you step". Instead of fixing the problem, they just wait to see what happen.
In conclusion, Culiacan Zoo has to many things to improve, but it needs to start right now to reborn as the good zoo it used to be.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631016468.name: Animal\u00b4s life
631016468.author: a TripAdvisor user
631016468.reviewBody: The zoo is a good place to be with your Friends and family, there are a lot of fun activities to do, but the real problem is the animals and how they live, they have very poor conditions and their cages are so small, they are not clean and their water supplies are not completely clean. some animals escaped from their cages when i went there, two pigs were walking around the zoo, and they were afraid of the humans.\nThe installations were not completely in place, the zoo looked like if it was abandoned. The restrooms doors could not close, the food court was horrible and the cages of the animals were all dirty. Some animals did not have clean water and they looked so sad, some other animals looked so slim, like if they did not had a single food in days.Also The zoo was so dirty that there was poop in the floor, even a dead lizard that we almost stepped on.\nThe zoo was in horrible conditions, i would not recommend too much to go and spend a nice time there, because it is empty and dirty, some parts of the zoo smelled so bad, and the animals were so dirty so they smelled bad. Before the zoo was a good place and had it\u00b4s areas more clean, they were a lot more animals and they were in better conditions, that is why the zoo nowadays is not a good place to visit in culiacan.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

631016334.name: A place that you have to visit
631016334.author: a TripAdvisor user
631016334.reviewBody: There are many places in Culiacan that you can visit, like Catedral, La lomita, Parque las riberas, among others, but the zoo is special. A zoo is a place where you can see animals of any type and Culiacan has one. This is located in Calle Gral Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855, Las Quintas. But why is the zoo the best place to visit in Culiacan, In my opinion, visiting the zoo can be a great experience for people and more if you go as a family, there you can see many animals and you can see them from nearby and even touch them. This zoo is very special because despite seeing the animals and all that, it is very well maintained, there are food reels, it is very well where the animals live and the decoration is great. Also going with your friends can be a great experience because you can take pictures with animals, you can spend all day there without getting bored, there are also signs outside the cages of animals that describe exactly what kind of animal it is and also how it is their behavior. Something that I also like about the zoo is the entrance, it has the letters of zoo on a giant wall of stone, they are blue, black and orange and it makes it a very interesting and beautiful entrance. It also has a bridge that connects the riverside park and makes it special. Besides the zoo is very cheap, they only charge 30 pesos per adult and 25 per children. the zoooligo is an essential place to have fun with friends and family and you can learn a lot from the fauna of the world.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

630996290.name: Culiacan\u00b4s Zoo
630996290.author: a TripAdvisor user
630996290.reviewBody: If you are planning to visit Culiacan, you probably would want some activities to do. "El Zoologico de Culiacan" is one of the best places to visit with your family, it has one of the biggest aviaries in America, containing lots of birds that you can feed and take photos with. There are a lot of different species, from lions and jaguars, to turtles and giraffes. If you get tired of walking, there is a little shop where you can buy food and drinks. If you are visiting with your whole family, there is even a zone where there are some sea lions. There is also a reptile zone, where you can see a variety of snakes and lizards When you are done visiting the zoo you can easily move to "Parque Las Rivera\u2019s", there is a bridge that will get you there and you\u00b4ll be able to do some shopping or even watch a movie. In any case, the zoo is a perfect place to visit alone, or with your family, so I would highly recommend it to anyone who visits Culiacan, especially if you have kids, they would be amazed with the variety of species in the zoo. It is a great place to see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

571783640.name: Good Variety of Animals
571783640.author: a TripAdvisor user
571783640.reviewBody: I had a good time at this zoo--lots of different birds, monkeys, and felines to see. There is an area where you can feed the giraffes, which was super cool! There is also apparently a live seal show you can attend, although I didn\'t have the time. All in all, a fun experience hanging out with the animals!

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

548400906.name: Highly recommended place to visit
548400906.author: a TripAdvisor user
548400906.reviewBody: I was surprised by the number of unique animals, and size of the Culiacan zoo, compared to other similarly sized cities in USA

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

430406012.name: So many animals
430406012.author: a TripAdvisor user
430406012.reviewBody: There isn\'t a bad thing that I can say about this zoo. I don\'t remember exactly but I think it was like $2 a person. It\'s very large and you can get up close and personal with all of the animals (within a safe level of course). They had such a variety of animals. I was really impressed. Similar zoos in the US cost 10x as much. The animals appear to be treated humanely. I try to return every time we go because it\'s just something fun to do with the family.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

410766818.name: Very beautiful. Good variety in animals
410766818.author: a TripAdvisor user
410766818.reviewBody: It\'s incredible! There are so many animals to see and observe! You can even buy a cup of carrots to feed the giraffes and camels for a very small price. Entrance fee I believe was only 20 pesos per person! It doesn\'t get much better than that. The birds are stunning and some don\'t even have a cage or glass compartment which makes it much more special to observe them and take pictures. There\'s many animals from a white lion to a hippo to miniature pigs! Kid friendly environment and adults will love it even more!

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

410097395.name: A Must visit place if you ever come to Culiacan
410097395.author: a TripAdvisor user
410097395.reviewBody: It is a modern zoo with a good diversity in number of species, it is quite small in size but will take a good couple of hours to walk around, great for younger kids and teenagers, the park includes other facilities near by to complement your visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

409737337.name: Birds, birds birds \ud83d\ude0d
409737337.author: a TripAdvisor user
409737337.reviewBody: My favourite part of the zoo was the Aviary. Absolutely beautiful. The enclosures for some of the animals could be improved.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael Buelna Tenorio 855

675241014.name: Una gran experiencia
675241014.author: a TripAdvisor user
675241014.reviewBody: La atenci\u00f3n de los chicos, las exhibiciones y el mensaje positivo que te llevas despu\u00e9s de visitar el MIA #NoTienePrecio

address.streetAddress: Calle General Angel Flores Nte 484 Av. Dr. Ruperto Paliza

662902480.name: Buenas funciones y exposiciones en una ubicaci\u00f3n perfecta
662902480.author: a TripAdvisor user
662902480.reviewBody: Este lugar es muy vers\u00e1til en cuanto a lo que ofrece, hay exposiciones, presentaciones y todo lo relacionado con cultura, adem\u00e1s su ubicaci\u00f3n es inmejorable en el centro de la ciudad.

address.streetAddress: Calle General Angel Flores Nte 484 Av. Dr. Ruperto Paliza
